author: Sheena McGinley
title: Pics: Kate Middleton showcases lovely monochrome guna at 'Mind' charity event in London
text:
Kate Middleton and the hubby were attending a Mind charity event over the weekend at Harrow College in London, highlighting the importance of mental health issues. The royal couple were there to specifically address Time to Change, the anti-stigma campaign .
The Duchess wowed in a black and white Tory Birch dress, which will invariably sell out worldwide now that it's had such a high profile outing.
Back in February, during the UK's first ever Children's Mental Health Week , Kate said: "Both William and I have seen that many young people are struggling to cope with the impact of bullying, bereavement, domestic violence, family breakdown and more. Without support, the effects of these challenges can be traumatic, leading to serious issues such as anxiety, depression, addiction, and self harm... The stigma surrounding mental health means that children don't get the help they so badly need. This needs to change."
